msContents.summary: Scripture by various authors known as New Testament [r]

objectDesc.p: Papyrus, 24x13, 10 extant leaf(s), 1 column(s), 25-30 line(s) per column, 22-32 characters per line, written in Greek.

handDesc.handNote: 250-299 Original scribe with documentary hand (127 verses).

history.provenance: Excavated at Atfîḥ, Miṣr in the ruins of a monastery.
Purchased 1931 by Chester Beatty at Al Qāhirah, Miṣr from antiquities dealer.
Transferred 1950 to Chester Beatty Library at Dublin, Ireland.

msIdentifier.msName: BP III, Chester Beatty Library, Dublin, Ireland.

sourceDesc.bibl: Kenyon, Frederic G., The Chester Beatty Biblical Papyri: Fasciculus III/1, Pauline Epistles and Revelation, Text, Emery Walker: London, England, 1934. OCLC 1097140.
